subject: refactor: unify semantic status colors with jewel tone palette
body:
Replace separate semantic status colors (green/red/amber) with jewel tones:
- Success/Positive → Accent (Emerald Teal #00BFA5)
- Error/Warning/Destructive → Secondary (Ruby Magenta #E91E63)
- Info/Neutral → Primary (Sapphire Blue #3D5AFE)

Benefits:
- Simplifies color system from 7 colors to 3 core jewel tones
- More cohesive visual identity using teal/ruby instead of green/red
- Ruby already used for attention states (unread badges, warnings)
- All semantic class names preserved (bg-success, bg-error, etc.)

Changes:
- styles/theme.js: Map semantic colors to jewel tones with comments
- tailwind.config.js: Update comments to reflect jewel tone mapping
- components/ChatListItem.tsx: Update shadow color for End Chat button
- CLAUDE.md: Document new semantic color mapping and design philosophy
title: unify semantic status colors with jewel tone palette
